column4: I am trying to seperate the truth from the hype and am having a hard time at it. Is unity going to replace gnome on Ubuntu? and If it is, can someone point me to another OS, because Unity sucks?
heh hey so what makes unity suck so much
a) I cannot change the theme b) buttons forced to left side, where they don't belong c) exceptionally buggy d) I am a gnome fan..:)
you mean you can't move that thing to the right side??
correct, buttons should be on the right unless there is a cute picture of an apple on my computer, and my mouse only has one button :)
ohhh i thought you meant the big menu bar buttons on the left side of the screen
you can force those window buttons to the right with a little gconf magic
i heard it through google, reading ubuntu posts... I would love unity if it was a second choice, and if it allowed me to put things where I want like gnome.
not on unity. they are stuck to the left side, because gconf controls gnome, not unity.
so has anyone else heard this "gossip" because i would love to belive it aint so. personally, if i could wish one peice of software out of existence, it would be unity.
yeah but is unity really all that different from gnome 3 when you look at it
yes. gnome is configurable, and unity is not. and unity doesn't give me a desktop. i like to make things work and look my way, and unity, atleast for now, is unchangeable.
i didnt know unity was so unconfigurable. you'd think it would be if not now then later on.. you sure there isn't some  hidden 'gconf' style thing in there somewhere
well, as of 5 months ago the was not.
it's ok man, not your fault, I was actually hoping you would tell me it's all just gossip, and not based on reality :(
well im gonna be in ubuntu-offtopic i got a theory on al this
